criteria: Ability to locate and identify sources of information regarding alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.
Understanding of the products and services related to alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.
Ability to critically evaluate the accuracy and reliability of information.
Application of accessed information to make informed decisions related to personal health.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no ability to locate or identify information sources.
Student can locate very few sources of information, with significant difficulty.
Student can locate some sources of information, but struggles to identify their relevance or reliability.
Student can locate and identify several relevant sources of information, but may have minor difficulties assessing reliability.
Student can effectively locate and identify reliable and relevant sources of information.
Student can efficiently locate, identify, and critically evaluate a wide range of sources, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of where to find pertinent information.
Student shows no understanding of related products and services.
Student demonstrates minimal awareness of related products and services, with significant misconceptions.
Student can identify some related products and services, but lacks a clear understanding of their purpose or function.
Student identifies several related products and services with a basic understanding of their purpose.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of various products and services related to alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs, and can explain their potential impact.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the entire range of products and services, including emerging trends and nuanced effects.
Student shows no ability to critically evaluate information.
Student accepts information at face value without questioning its validity.
Student attempts to evaluate information but demonstrates difficulty distinguishing between reliable and unreliable sources.
Student can identify some potential biases or inaccuracies in information sources.
Student demonstrates a good ability to assess the reliability and accuracy of information, identifying potential biases and limitations.
Student consistently and effectively evaluates information sources, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of bias, methodology, and potential conflicts of interest.
Student is unable to apply the information to make informed decisions.
Student struggles to connect accessed information to personal health decisions.
Student attempts to apply information but demonstrates limited understanding of its practical implications.
Student can make basic connections between information and personal health choices.
Student uses accessed information to make informed decisions about their health and well-being.

Student uses accessed information to not only make informed decisions for themselves but can also provide guidance and education to others, demonstrating leadership and a deep understanding of the topic.
